intro: Andrachne brittonii, commonly known as the brittlestem sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and has small, green, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and are borne on slender stems. Andrachne brittonii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
